title: Comey’s Lawyers Head to Court to Argue Vindictive Prosecution by Trump
summary: James B. Comey’s lawyers are expected to argue that the Justice Department effectively allowed itself to be taken captive by the president’s desire for political revenge.

title: Larry Summers Resigns From OpenAI’s Board
summary: Mr. Summers’ departure from the artificial intelligence company’s board followed revelations of his communications with the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Sent Trade Plummeting in August
summary: The steep tariffs President Trump issued in August led to a contraction in imports and the trade deficit, newly released data shows.

title: How Trump and Nvidia’s C.E.O. Became Partners on the International Stage
summary: Over the last 10 months, President Trump has become close with Jensen Huang, Nvidia’s chief executive, as the company’s chips have become a tool in trade and peace talks.

title: Nvidia and Walmart Could Ease Wall St.’s Jitters. Or Make Them Worse.
summary: After four consecutive down days, the stock market is looking increasingly queasy. Earnings reports from Nvidia, Walmart and Target could hint at what’s ahead.

title: Netherlands Hands Back Control of Chinese-Owned Chipmaker Nexperia
summary: Uncertainty over the availability of the company’s chips, which are used in cars and electronics, had added to concerns of a global shortage.

title: Trump Lauds M.B.S. During White House Visit and Dismisses Khashoggi’s Killing
summary: President Trump rejected a U.S. intelligence report finding that Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman had ordered the murder of a journalist.

title: Saudi Arabia Backs Elon Musk’s xAI With Data Center Deal
summary: Mr. Musk’s xAI will work with the Saudi artificial intelligence company Humain on a new data center, part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s effort to diversify his country’s economy.

title: Trump Berates Mary Bruce of ABC News After Question About Jamal Khashoggi
summary: The president grew frustrated with Mary Bruce of ABC News over her questions during his meeting with the Saudi crown prince. On Friday, he told a Bloomberg News reporter, “Quiet, piggy.”

title: Melania Trump’s Green Gown Signals Saudi Arabia Diplomatic Ties
summary: At the official dinner for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the first lady offered an unexpected sign of allegiance.

title: Orthodox Church Pews Are Overflowing With Converts
summary: “In the whole history of the Orthodox Church in America, this has never been seen,” a priest said about the surge of young men drawn to the demanding practice of Christianity.

title: How Two New York Times Reporters Cover Christianity in Trump’s Polarized America
summary: We asked our journalists who write about religion nationwide about how they navigate debates about what Christianity is and isn’t.

title: Thanksgiving Pies So Good, You’ll Want to Skip Dinner
summary: Go straight to the good stuff this Thanksgiving: apple and cream, chocolate espresso, honeyed cranberry and more.

title: Don’t Tread on Frank: How One Man’s Yard Became a Battlefield
summary: The clash is about strong personalities, an exacting homeowners’ association and a partisan divide that has reached the hyperlocal level.

title: Anxiety Over Trump’s Crackdown Alters Life for Many Immigrants, Poll Finds
summary: Months into the Trump deportation campaign, one-third of noncitizens, including about 60 percent of undocumented immigrants, say they are avoiding aspects of daily life.

title: Most Immigrants Support Border Enforcement, but Not Mass Deportations, Poll Finds
summary: A survey by The New York Times and KFF shows that even many of those who support President Trump feel his approach has gone too far.

title: What Polls Say About Americans’ Views on Immigrants and Immigration
summary: A review of polls of the general public shows how opinions on immigration vary widely based on the details included in poll questions.

title: Russian Missile Kills at Least 25 in Ukrainian Apartment Building
summary: The attack was part of a wave of strikes across the country as President Volodymyr Zelensky seeks to revive stalled peace talks.

title: Zelensky Under Siege as Corruption Case Shatters Ukraine’s Wartime Unity
summary: An anti-Zelensky political coalition is coalescing as the president’s allies are accused of enriching themselves while the country’s soldiers die on the battlefield.

title: What to Know About the Corruption Scandal Roiling Ukraine
summary: An investigation into the state-owned nuclear power company has reached members of President Volodymyr Zelensky’s inner circle.

title: For Victims of Sexual Assault on Cruise Ships, Justice Can Be Elusive
summary: As cruise travel hits record demand, cases of sexual assault have also risen. Many accusers learn that the rights they had on land don’t always apply.

title: Jessica Tisch Will Remain Police Commissioner Under Mamdani
summary: Commissioner Tisch, the current head of the N.Y.P.D., said she had agreed to serve in Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s administration.

title: As Mamdani Tries to Woo the N.Y.P.D., He Is Met With Skepticism and Hope
summary: Zohran Mamdani takes office on Jan. 1 with ambitious plans to rethink policing and some officers angry about his past criticisms. Winning them over could be a key to a successful term.

title: New Gene-Editing Strategy Could Help Development of Treatments for Rare Diseases
summary: Instead of requiring personalized gene edits for each patient, the new approach could create a standardized method to use for many diseases.

title: In Washington, Birds Are Giving ‘Yelp Reviews’ of Forest Restoration Work
summary: A collective of land trusts, conservancies and tribes is capturing birdsong with audio gear and A.I. for clues about habitat health.

title: Body Slams, Curated: Pro Wrestling Enters Its Museum Era
summary: The over-the-top spectacle has been slicing into the art world, with gallery shows, performances and a forthcoming major exhibition.

title: Jeffrey Epstein’s Victims Are the Real Story
summary: Women’s pain is not entertainment.

title: Patreon’s C.E.O.: My Vision for a Better Internet
summary: The internet should enrich people, not advertisers.

title: How Are Immigrants Feeling?
summary: We explain the latest insights from a poll on their attitudes about the country.

title: Stephen Colbert Celebrates ‘Epstein Rockin’ Eve’
summary: “Stay up for a ball drop you’re going to want to miss,” the “Late Show” host said as Congress voted for the release of the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: The Key to Fighting Lung Cancer Is More Screenings, New Study Shows
summary: A new report says too few eligible Americans are being checked for the country’s deadliest cancer before it spreads.

title: Who’s Running to Replace Jerry Nadler? 10 People and Counting.
summary: Mr. Nadler’s coveted House seat in Manhattan will be up for grabs next year in a district that is the wealthiest in New York.

title: Tom Steyer Will Run for California Governor in 2026 Race
summary: Tom Steyer, who ran for president in 2020 and funded an effort to impeach President Trump, will join the crowded field trying to succeed Gov. Gavin Newsom.

title: At This College, the English Dept. Is Out. ‘Human Narratives’ Is In.
summary: At Montclair State University in New Jersey, a departmental restructuring plan is igniting concerns about the future of the humanities.
